revised_title: A Study of the Skull and Dentition of Paraceratherium Bugtiense: An Aberrant Rhinoceros from Lower Miocene Deposits
tldr: The author examines the skull and dentition of Paraceratherium bugtiense, an aberrant rhinoceros from the lower Miocene deposits of Dera Bugti. They describe the unique features of the front teeth, which form downwardly turned tusks, and discuss the differences in skull shape and size compared to modern rhinoceroses. The author also notes the variation in the ear region and the flat vomer extending forward, which is different from modern Perissodactyles.
